title: Affine Transformation Parameters
content: An affine transformation x ↦ ax + b. The AffineParams structure holds r transformations with coefficients (aᵢ, bᵢ).

title: Density Condition Σ(1/aᵢ) > 1
content: The critical condition requiring the sum of reciprocals of the aᵢ values to exceed 1. This 'density' condition ensures enough coverage for collisions.

title: Transformation T
content: T(A) = (aᵢxⱼ + bᵢ) for all combinations of i ∈ {1,...,r} and j ∈ {1,...,n}. This produces a sequence of length rn from one of length n.

title: Iteration and Repetition
content: Starting with A₁ = (1), define Aₖ₊₁ = T(Aₖ). The sequence Aₖ has repeated elements if some value appears at least twice.

title: Klarner's Theorem (1982)
content: If Σ(1/aᵢ) > 1, then some iterate Aₖ must have repeated elements. This is the main result solving Erdős Problem #481.

title: Why the Condition Matters
content: The density condition Σ(1/aᵢ) > 1 means transformations 'overlap' enough. If we think of [0,N] covered by intervals of length N/aᵢ, total coverage exceeds N, so pigeonhole applies.

title: Free Semigroup Connection
content: The affine semigroup generated by x ↦ aᵢx + bᵢ is free iff Σ(1/aᵢ) ≤ 1. When non-free, the semigroup has relations which manifest as collisions in sequences.

title: Special Cases
content: Examples: (1) a₁=a₂=2 gives Σ=1 (boundary); (2) a₁=2,a₂=3 gives Σ=5/6<1 (no forced collisions); (3) a₁=a₂=a₃=2 gives Σ=3/2>1 (collisions must occur).

title: Historical Notes
content: Erdős-Graham noted 'It is surprising that [this problem] offers difficulty.' Ryan Alweiss showed the minimum element condition is always satisfied. Kevin Barreto independently found Klarner's proof.

title: Summary and Resolution
content: Erdős Problem #481 is SOLVED: when Σ(1/aᵢ) > 1, the affine iteration eventually produces repeated elements. The condition is tight - Σ(1/aᵢ) ≤ 1 can avoid collisions.
